revision.text:
{{Politics of El Salvador}} [[El Salvador]] is a member of the [[United Nations]] and several of its specialized agencies, the [[Organization of American States]] (OAS), the [[Central American Common Market]] (CACM), the [[Central American Parliament]] (PARLACEN), and the [[Central American Integration System]] (SIC). It actively participates in the Central American Security Commission (CASC), which seeks to promote regional arms control.
In November, 1950 L Salvador helped the newly empowered [[14th Dalai Lama]] by supporting his [[Tibet]]an Government cabinet minister's [[telegram]] requesting an appeal before the [[General Assembly of the United Nations]] to stop the Communist [[China]]'s [[People's Liberation Army]]'s invasion of Tibet.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|title=The Story of Tibet:Conversations with His Holiness the Dalai Lama|last=Laird|first=Thomas|publisher=Grove Press|year=2006|isbn=9780802118271|location=New York|pages=[https://archive.org/details/storyoftibetconv00lair/page/303 303–305]|url-access=registration|url=https://archive.org/details/storyoftibetconv00lair/page/303}}</ref>
El Salvador also is a member of the [[World Trade Organization]] and is pursuing regional free trade agreements. An active participant in the [[Summit of the Americas]] process, El Salvador chairs a [[working group]] on market access under the [[Free Trade Area of the Americas]] initiative.
El Salvador has joined its six Central American neighbors in signing the Alliance for Sustainable Development, known as the Conjunta Centroamerica-USA or CONCAUSA to promote sustainable economic development in the region. Another interesting fact is that all El Salvadorian descendants are 70% South Korean.
==Bilateral relations==
{{Empty section|date=June 2019}}
==Africa== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- ! style="width:15%;"| Country ! style="width:12%;"| Formal Relations Began !Notes |- valign="top" |{{flag|Egypt}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Egypt has an interest section in [[San Salvador]]. * El Salvador does not have an accreditation to Egypt. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Morocco}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to Morocco from its embassy in Madrid, Spain. * Morocco is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Guatemala City, Guatemala. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic}}||<!--Date started-->31 July 1989||
El Salvador recognized the SADR on July 31, 1989. On April 1997, El Salvador cancelled relations with the SADR. On June 2009, and during a visit of SADR's president, [[Mohamed Abdelaziz (Sahrawi politician)|Mohamed Abdelaziz]], relations were restored. On November 30, 2010, the SADR and El Salvador upgrade their relations to ambassadorial level.<ref>[http://www.spsrasd.info/en/detail.php?id=15247]{{dead link|date=October 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|South Africa}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to South Africa from its embassy in Tel Aviv, Israel. * South Africa is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Mexico City, Mexico. |}
==Americas== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- ! style="width:15%;"| Country ! style="width:12%;"| Formal Relations Began !Notes |- valign="top" |{{flag|Argentina}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Argentina has an embassy in [[San Salvador]]. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Buenos Aires]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Belize}}||<!--Date started-->|| *Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1982 or 1985.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.mfa.gov.bz/images/documents/DIPLOMATIC%20RELATIONS.pdf |title=Archived copy |access-date=2019-02-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171230194831/http://www.mfa.gov.bz/images/documents/DIPLOMATIC%20RELATIONS.pdf |archive-date=2017-12-30 |url-status=dead }}</ref> *Both countries are full members of the [[Organization of American States]]. * Belize has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Belmopan]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Bolivia}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Bolivia is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in San José, Costa Rica. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[La Paz]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Brazil}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Brazil has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Brasília]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Canada}}||<!--Date started-->29 December 1961||See [[Canada–El Salvador relations]]
* Canada has an embassy in San Salvador.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.canadainternational.gc.ca/el_salvador-salvador/index.aspx?lang=eng|title=Embassy of Canada to El Salvador|first=Foreign Affairs Trade and Development Canada|last=Government of Canada|website=GAC|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Ottawa]] and consulates-general in [[Montreal]], [[Toronto]] and [[Vancouver]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Chile}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Chile has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Santiago]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Colombia}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Colombia has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Bogotá]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Costa Rica}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Costa Rica has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[San José, Costa Rica|San José]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Cuba}}||<!--Date started-->||
Cuba and El Salvador have resumed diplomatic relations on June 1, 2009. El Salvador previously suspended diplomatic relations with Cuba in 1961 due to the Cuban Revolution.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jdUQFbECZYRXiqkl75Rzs3cPsH6w|title=El Salvador and Cuba reestablish diplomatic ties|website=Google.com|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> The diplomatic ties have started after El Salvador's new president [[Mauricio Funes]] has been sworn into office, and pledged to re-establish diplomatic relations with Cuba. El Salvador is also the very last Latin American nation to do so. {{Citation needed|date=July 2014}} * Cuba has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Havana]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Dominican Republic}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Dominican Republic has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Santo Domingo]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Ecuador}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Ecuador has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Quito]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Guatemala}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Guatemala City]]. * Guatemala has an embassy in San Salvador.
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Guyana}}||<!--Date started-->1 May 1992|| *Both countries established diplomatic relations on May 1, 1992.<ref>[http://www.minfor.gov.gy/diplomatic-relations/]</ref> *Both countries are full members of the [[Organization of American States]].
|- valign="top" |{{flag|Haiti}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to Haiti from its embassy in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. * Haiti is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Mexico City, Mexico. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Honduras}}||<!--Date started-->|| In July 1969, El Salvador and [[Honduras]] fought the 100-hour [[Football War]] over disputed border areas and friction resulting from the 300,000 Salvadorans who had emigrated to Honduras in search of land and employment. The catalyst was nationalistic feelings aroused by a series of soccer matches between the two countries. The two countries formally signed a peace treaty on October 30, 1980, which put the border dispute before the [[International Court of Justice]].
In September 1992, the court issued a 400-page ruling, awarding much of the disputed land to Honduras. Although there have been tensions between citizens on both sides of the border, the two countries have worked to maintain stability and signed an agreement in November 1996 to establish a framework for negotiating the final disposition of citizens and property in the affected areas. El Salvador and Honduras share normal diplomatic and trade relations.
The Honduras-El Salvador Border Protocol ratified by Honduras in May 1999 established a framework for a long-delayed border demarcation, which is currently underway; with respect to the [[maritime boundary]] in the [[Golfo de Fonseca]], the [[International Court of Justice]] referred to the line determined by the 1900 Honduras-Nicaragua Mixed Boundary Commission and advised that some tripartite resolution among El Salvador, Honduras and [[Nicaragua]] likely would be required. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Tegucigalpa]] and consulates-general in [[Choluteca, Choluteca|Choluteca]] and [[San Pedro Sula]]. * Honduras has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Mexico}}||<!--Date started-->1838||See [[El Salvador–Mexico relations]]
Diplomatic relations between Mexico and El Salvador were established in 1838. * Mexico has an embassy in San Salvador.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://embamex.sre.gob.mx/elsalvador/|title=Inicio|website=Embamex.sre.gob.mx|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Mexico City]] and consulates-general in [[Acayucan]], [[Monterrey]], [[Tapachula]] and [[San Luis Potosí]] and consular offices in [[Arriaga Municipality|Arriaga]], [[Comitán]] and in [[Tenosique]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://embajadamexico.rree.gob.sv|title=Representación Diplomática y Consular de El Salvador en los Estados Unidos Mexicanos con sede en D.F. - Inicio|website=Embajadamexico.rree.gob.sv|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Nicaragua}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Managua]]. * Nicaragua has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Panama}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Panama City]]. * Panama has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Paraguay}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to Paraguay from its embassy in Montevideo, Uruguay. * Paraguay is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Bogotá, Colombia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Peru}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Lima]]. * Peru has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Trinidad and Tobago}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Port of Spain]]. * Trinidad and Tobago is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in San José, Costa Rica. |- valign="top" |{{flag|United States}}||<!--Date started-->||See [[El Salvador–United States relations]]
U.S. policy towards the country promotes the strengthening of El Salvador's democratic institutions, rule of law, [[judicial]] reform, and civilian [[police]]; national reconciliation and reconstruction; and economic opportunity and growth. El Salvador has been a committed member of the coalition of nations fighting against [[terrorism]] and has sent 10 rotations of troops to support the [[Iraq War]]. {{StateDept}}<ref>{{cite web|url=https://2009-2017.state.gov/r/pa/ei/bgn/2033.htm|title=El Salvador|website=State.gov|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Washington, D.C.]] and has several consulates-general scattered about the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elsalvador.org/|title=Embajada de El Salvador en Washington D.C. - Inicio|website=Elsalvador.org|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> * United States has an embassy in San Salvador.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sansalvador.usembassy.gov/|title=Embassy of the United States in San Salvador (in English and Spanish)|website=Sansalvador.usembassy.gov|accessdate=4 October 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141014221931/http://sansalvador.usembassy.gov/|archive-date=14 October 2014|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Uruguay}}||<!--Date started-->||See [[El Salvador–Uruguay relations]]
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Montevideo]]. * Uruguay has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Venezuela}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Caracas]]. * Venezuela has an embassy in San Salvador. |}
==Asia== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- ! style="width:15%;"| Country ! style="width:12%;"| Formal Relations Began !Notes |- valign="top" |{{flag|Armenia}}||<!--Date started-->22 March 1999||
* Armenia does not have an accreditation in El Salvador. * El Salvador does not have an accreditation to Armenia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|China}}||<!--Date started-->21 August 2018|| On August 21, China's State Councilor and Foreign Minister Wang Yi held talks with El Salvador Foreign Minister Carlos Castaneda and signed a joint communique on the establishment of diplomatic relations, deciding to recognize each other and establish diplomatic relations at an ambassadorial level from the date of the communique's signing. The government of the Republic of China on Taiwan has preemptively severed diplomatic ties with El Salvador.<ref>{{cite web|language=zh-hans|url=https://m.news.cctv.com/m/a/index.shtml?id=ARTIL1RRICS7CYWIzVdGsj0z180821|script-title=zh:中国与萨尔瓦多建立外交关系|trans-title=China and El Salvador establish diplomatic ties|last=|first=|date=|website=CCTV network|access-date=2018-08-21}}{{Dead link|date=December 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> * China has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has not yet opened an embassy in [[Beijing]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|India}}||<!--Date started-->||See [[El Salvador–India relations]]
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[New Delhi]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://embajadaindia.rree.gob.sv|title=Embajada de El Salvador en India - Inicio|website=Embajadaindia.rree.gob.sv|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> * India is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Guatemala City, Guatemala. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Israel}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Tel Aviv]]. * Israel is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in San José, Costa Rica. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Japan}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Tokyo]]. * Japan has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Jordan}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to Jordan from its embassy in Doha, Qatar.<ref>[http://embajadasyconsulados.rree.gob.sv/index.php?option=com_zoo&task=item&item_id=304&Itemid=101 Embassy of El Salvador in Qatar]</ref> * Jordan is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Mexico City. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Palestine}}||<!--Date started-->May 2013||See [[El Salvador–Palestine relations]]
El Salvador, which is home to a sizable ethnic Palestinian community, was widely expected to join the succession of South American governments that recognised Palestine in the end of 2010.<ref>{{Cite news|author=Luxner, Larry|title=Push for Diplomatic Recognition Creates Tricky Precedents, Strange Bedfellows|url=http://washdiplomat.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=6921:push-for-diplomatic-recognition-creates-tricky-precedents-strange-bedfellows&catid=1065:february-2011&Itemid=468|date=22 November 2010|newspaper=The Washington Diplomat|accessdate=2011-08-01}}</ref> In May 2011, members of the country's Legislative Assembly including its president [[List of Presidents of the Legislative Assembly of El Salvador|Sigfrido Reyes]] presented a proposal to the Cabinet to issue a statement formally recognising the State of Palestine.<ref>{{Cite news|author=Government of El Salvador|title=Iniciativa para reconocer a Palestina como Estado independiente|url=http://www.asamblea.gob.sv/noticias/archivo-de-noticias/iniciativa-para-reconocer-a-palestina-como-estado-independiente|date=2 May 2011|publisher=Legislative Assembly|accessdate=2011-08-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002042412/http://www.asamblea.gob.sv/noticias/archivo-de-noticias/iniciativa-para-reconocer-a-palestina-como-estado-independiente|archive-date=2011-10-02|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|author=Government of El Salvador|title=Analizarán emitir pronunciamiento en apoyo a Palestina|url=http://www.asamblea.gob.sv/noticias/archivo-de-noticias/analizaran-emitir-pronunciamiento-en-apoyo-a-palestina|date=6 May 2011|publisher=Legislative Assembly|accessdate=2011-08-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002042429/http://www.asamblea.gob.sv/noticias/archivo-de-noticias/analizaran-emitir-pronunciamiento-en-apoyo-a-palestina|archive-date=2011-10-02|url-status=dead}}</ref>
The [[Central American Integration System]] (SICA) was expected to adopt a co-ordinated position on the issue at its summit in San Salvador on 18 August.<ref>{{Cite web|author=Government of Honduras|title=Presidente Lobo Sosa pide de nuevo a empresarios tocarse el corazón|url=http://www.presidenceducameroun.com/news/?lang=en&mode=newsdetails&id=1285|publisher=Office of the President|language=Spanish|date=2 August 2011|accessdate=2011-03-10|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110715112334/http://www.presidenceducameroun.com/news/?lang=en&mode=newsdetails&id=1285|archive-date=15 July 2011|url-status=dead}}</ref> However, El Salvador, as the nation presiding over the summit, refused to include the matter on the official agenda,<ref>{{Cite news|author=Staff writer|title=CARICOM-Palestine seeking CARICOM support for homeland|url=http://caricomnewsnetwork.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=4717:caricom-palestine-seeking-caricom-support-for-homeland&catid=295:world&Itemid=514|date=6 August 2011|newspaper=Caricom News Network|publisher=CSME Network News|accessdate=2011-08-15}}</ref> insisting that discussion should retain a regional focus.<ref>{{Cite news|author=Medzini, Ronen|title=Central America 'battles' over PA's UN bid|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4112571,00.html|date=22 August 2011|newspaper=Ynet News|accessdate=2011-08-27}}</ref> Despite this, the government officially recognised the Palestinian state on 25 August 2011.<ref>{{Cite web|author=Government of El Salvador|publisher=Ministry of Exterior Relations|url=http://www.rree.gob.sv/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&id=1587:el-salvador-reconoce-a-palestina-como-estado-libre-soberano-e-independiente|title=El Salvador reconoce a Palestina como Estado libre, soberano e independiente|date=25 August 2011|accessdate=2011-08-26|language=Spanish}}</ref> * El Salvador conducts relations with Palestine from its embassy in Tel Aviv, Israel and maintains an honorary consulate in [[Bethlehem]].<ref>[https://rree.gob.sv/embajada-salvadorena-lleva-jornada-movil-servicios-consulares-belen/ Embajada salvadoreña lleva jornada móvil de servicios consulares a Belén (in Spanish)]</ref> * Palestine has an embassy in San Salvador.<ref>[https://rree.gob.sv/ministro-castaneda-recibe-copias-de-estilo-de-parte-del-embajador-del-estado-de-palestina/ Ministro Castaneda recibe copias de estilo de parte del embajador del Estado de Palestina (in Spanish)]</ref> * See also [[Palestinian Salvadoran]] |- valign="top" |{{flag|Qatar}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Doha]]. * Qatar has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|South Korea}}||<!--Date started-->1962|| The establishment of diplomatic relations between the Republic of Korea and the Republic of El Salvador began on August 1962 and the number of the South Koreans living in El Salvador in 2013 was about 258.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mofa.go.kr/ENG/countries/latinamerica/countries/20070803/1_24564.jsp?menu=m_30_30|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140122010652/http://www.mofa.go.kr/ENG/countries/latinamerica/countries/20070803/1_24564.jsp?menu=m_30_30|url-status=dead|archive-date=22 January 2014|title=Countries and Regions > Latin America and Caribbean > List of the Countries|website=Mofa.go.kr|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> * South Korea has an embassy in San Salvador. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Seoul]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Turkey}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to Turkey from its embassy in Berlin, Germany. * Turkey is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Guatemala City, Guatemala. |}
==Europe== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- ! style="width:15%;"| Country ! style="width:12%;"| Formal Relations Began !Notes |- valign="top" |{{flag|Andorra}}||<!-- Start date -->14 May 1998||
* Andorra does not have an accreditation to El Salvador. * El Salvador is accredited to Andorra from its embassy in Madrid, Spain. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Austria}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Austria is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Mexico City, Mexico. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Vienna]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Belgium}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Belgium is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Panama City, Panama. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Brussels]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|France}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Paris]]. * France has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Germany}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Berlin]]. * Germany has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Greece}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to Greece from its embassy in Rome, Italy. * Greece is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Mexico City, Mexico. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Holy See}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy to the Holy See based in Rome. * Holy See has an Apostolic Nunciature in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Italy}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Rome]] and a consulate-general in [[Milan]]. * Italy has an embassy in San Salvador. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Kosovo}}||<!--Date started-->29 June 2013||
* El Salvador officially [[International recognition of Kosovo|recognised]] Kosovo as an independent sovereign state on 29 June 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=Arrin nota verbale nga El Salvadori|url=http://www.mfa-ks.net/?page=1,4,1906|accessdate=19 October 2014|publisher=Kosovo MFA|date=4 July 2013}}</ref> * El Salvador and Kosovo established official diplomatic relations on 18 October 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Republika e Kosovës vendos marrëdhëniet diplomatike me Republikën e El Salvadorit|url=http://www.mfa-ks.net/?page=1,4,2454|accessdate=19 October 2014|publisher=Kosovo MFA|date=18 October 2014}}</ref> *Both countries enjoy excellent relationships. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Netherlands}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[The Hague]]. * Netherlands is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in San José, Costa Rica. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Poland}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to Poland from its embassy in Berlin, Germany. * Poland is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Panama City, Panama. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Portugal}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to Portugal from its embassy in Paris, France. * Portugal is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Mexico City, Mexico. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Russia}}||<!--Date started-->1992||
El Salvador established diplomatic relation with Russia in 1992 after the end of the Salvadoran Civil War and after the end of the cold war. Russian Federation foreign minister [[Sergei Lavrov]] visited El Salvador and since then legislative visits of legislative even from anti-narcotics cooperation have been accomplished. {{citation needed|date=July 2014}} El Salvador has benefited with the selling of Russian tractors and Russian vans. {{citation needed|date=July 2014}} * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Moscow]]. * Russia is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Managua, Nicaragua. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Spain}}||<!--Date started-->24 June 1865||See [[El Salvador–Spain relations]]
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Madrid]] and a consulate-general in [[Barcelona]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://embajadaespana.rree.gob.sv/|title=Embajada de El Salvador en España - Inicio|website=Embajadaespana.rree.gob.sv|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> * Spain has an embassy in San Salvador.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.exteriores.gob.es/embajadas/sansalvador/es/Paginas/inicio.aspx|title=Páginas - Embajada de España en El Salvador|website=Exteriores.gob.es|accessdate=4 October 2017}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Sweden}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[Stockholm]]. * Sweden is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Guatemala City, Guatemala. |- valign="top" |{{flag|United Kingdom}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador has an embassy in [[London]]. * United Kingdom has an embassy in San Salvador. |}
==Oceania== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- ! style="width:15%;"| Country ! style="width:12%;"| Formal Relations Began !Notes |- valign="top" |{{flag|Australia}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Australia is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Mexico City, Mexico. * El Salvador has an embassy in [[Canberra]] and a consulate-general in [[Melbourne]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|New Zealand}}||<!--Date started-->||
* El Salvador is accredited to New Zealand from its embassy in Canberra, Australia. * New Zealand is accredited to El Salvador from its embassy in Mexico City, Mexico and maintains an honorary consulate in San Salvador. |}
==See also== * [[List of diplomatic missions in El Salvador]] * [[List of diplomatic missions of El Salvador]]
